items.item: Are the technical specification document covers the relevant specifications for all items required as per the scope of the tender and as listed in the schedule of items?
Does the schedule of items cover all the items as required by the scope of the tender?
Are the quantities indicated for the items in the schedule of quantities computed correctly covering the entire scope of work?
Whether the item/description indicated clearly and unambiguously the scope of supply and the work involved?
Are free issue items in the contract clearly indicated in the specification and the schedule of items?
Whether the document is prepared as per the guidelines in Tender Specification?
Are the values of parameters listed, correct?
Are the list of codes (Latest or as per Specification) to be followed completely?
Are the Load Combination for both Civil/Structural are listed Completely?
Are all-Basic Load definition/parameters are covered?
Are the Wind Load definition/parameters are covered Correctly?
Are the Seismic Load definition/parameters are covered Correctly?
Are the Min and Max values of Concrete (Clear Cover, min cement contents etc.) and Structure (Min thickness etc.) values are given as per code or Tender Specification.
Are the Grade of Concrete for RCC and PCC work are Specified as per Code or Tender Specification?
Are the Factor of safety for overturning/Sliding/Uplift are covered Correctly?
Are the Grade of Steel for Main Reinforcement and Secondary Reinforcement are Specified as per Code or Tender Specification?
Are the Grade of Structural Steel are Specified as per Code or Tender Specification?
Are the Design Philosophy for Main Important Structures are covered?
Are the Design Parameter (Bearing Capacity, Water Table, Pile Capacity, Pile length etc.) required to design the foundation are covered as per soil Report?
